Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND LEASE, LAND GRANTED RIGHT, LAND UNIT,LAND UNIT TRACT, LAND AGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.2: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.3: LR WELL SEQ NO: Unique identifier for the land right cross reference. Added toallow chronological sequencing of entries.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: GAS PERCENT PSU: The percentage of the gas production spacing unit for the wellwhich is credited to the Land Right.
Column Comment.9: KEY WELL IND: A yes/no indicator to indicate if the well has been used as abenchmark to identify a mineral zone.
Column Comment.10: OIL PERCENT PSU: The percentage of the oil production spacing unit for the wellwhich is credited to the Land Right.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: WELL STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observationnumber used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation (layer) that iscontributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.13: PRODUCTION STRING SOURCE: the source of the production string data.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: SPACING COMPLETE IND: Whether the well string completes the spacing unit
Column Comment.17: SPACING UNIT ID: unique identifier for the spacing unit.
Column Comment.18: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.19: WELL IN TRACT IND: Whether the well string, at the producing formation, isphysically located on the tract
Column Comment.20: WELL RELATIONSHIP TYPE: the type of relationship between the well and the landright. For example, a well may be inferred to be related to a land right because of itslocation, or the relationship may be explicitly stated in an agreement. In some cases,a well may not be located physically in a land right in order to have an association.Use this column in conjunction with WELL_IN_TRACT_IND and KEY_WELL_IND toprovide complete contextual information.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
